title: Bright spot on the skin
vignette: A pale patch appears on Miriam's arm and seems to spread.

options.text: Consult a medical professional immediately; it may be a serious condition.
Ignore it until it causes discomfort.

title: Quarantining suspected contagious patient
vignette: The community wants to isolate a person with suspicious lesions to protect others.

options.text: Isolate them for the full observation period.
Let them stay home but move freely.

title: Discoloration appearing after burn
vignette: A burn heals but leaves a white streak. Does it count as a medical concern?

options.text: Yes if color and size fit medical criteria.
Injuries from burns are exempt from disease protocols.

title: Hair turned completely white
vignette: A patch of hair turns white overnight with no other signs.

options.text: White hair alone signals a medical condition.
Without underlying skin change it is normal variation.

title: House with mold growth
vignette: Discoloration spreads on the inner wall of a home.

options.text: Remove the affected materials and clean the walls.
Paint over it and continue living there.

title: Garment showing unusual stains
vignette: A wool cloak develops streaks of unusual discoloration.

options.text: Dispose of the garment to prevent potential contamination.
Wash it several times and check again.

title: Closing a house for inspection
vignette: After examination, the health inspector orders the house sealed.

options.text: Comply and evacuate until reinspection.
Remain inside to guard belongings.

title: Infected person's clothing left in the home
vignette: Their garments remain indoors after they move out for treatment.

options.text: They pose contamination risk and must be disposed of.
Wash them thoroughly and reuse.

title: Symptoms during holiday week
vignette: Signs of illness appear during a major holiday celebration.

options.text: Suspend medical evaluation until after the holiday.
Examine immediately despite the holiday.

title: Doctor with poor eyesight
vignette: The only available doctor has weak vision to assess skin conditions.

options.text: They may still diagnose if experienced.
Another qualified doctor must be found or consulted.

title: Flaking skin after recovery
vignette: Following treatment, patches begin to flake off.

options.text: Consider it healed; no further medical concern.
Reassess; flakes may signal active condition.

title: Mold returns after treatment twice
vignette: After a second cleaning, discoloration returns yet again.

options.text: Condemn the entire structure now.
Try cleaning a third time before condemnation.

title: Person with symptoms travels away
vignette: A person with suspicious marks leaves before a doctor can examine them.

options.text: They remain healthy until medically examined.
Their departure renders them presumptively ill.

title: Shared space with contagious person
vignette: Neighbors debate whether the suspected contagious person may use the communal areas.

options.text: Restrict their access to avoid contamination.
Permit limited use with precautions.

title: Signs disappear before doctor arrives
vignette: By the time the doctor schedules a visit, the marks have faded.

options.text: They are healthy unless symptoms return.
Still count the first appearance as requiring treatment.
